IRS990.ActivityOrMissionDescription: The mission of the WIU Foundation is to maximize private support for Western Illinois University to assist in advancing its core values of academic excellence, educational opportunity, personal growth, and social responsibility. Private support enables Western Illinois University to enhance educational opportunities for its students and advance its mission of instruction, research, and public service.Private assistance is sought and administered with the primary objective of serving purposes other than those for which the State of Illinois makes sufficient appropriations.These contributions, when added to State resources, add an extra dimension by supporting programs that might not otherwise be possible. Such generosity enables Western Illinois University to enhance educational opportunities for its students and advance its mission of instruction, research, and public service.
IRS990.MissionDescription: Our mission is to maximize private support for Western Illinois University to assist in advancing its core values of academic excellence, educational opportunity, personal growth, and social responsibility. Private support enables Western Illinois University to enhance educational opportunities for its students and advance its mission of instruction, research, and public service.
IRS990.Description: Approximately, 2049 scholarships and awards were distributed during the year. Grant totals: Scholarships: 1,964,589; Faculty awards and grants $21,207; Education: $417,796 TOTAL: $2,403,592.

Activity2.Description: University: Provided financial support to departments, instructions, research, special projects, and other designated areas to enhance a variety of university programs.

OtherSecurities.Description: Cash Equivalents held in Investment Pools

OtherAssets.Description: Cash Surrender value of life insurance policies

Form990ScheduleDPartXIV.Explanation: Change in surrender value of life insurance: 49848. Change in value of charitable remainder trust: 57686.
Change in surrender value of life insurance: 49848. Special event expenses: 142477. Change in value of charitable remainder trusts: 57686.

Both quasi and true endowments funds are used to provide scholarship support, supplies support, travel abroad support, and various other forms of educational support for students and teachers at Western Illinois University. The majority of endowments provide scholarship support to students.

RecipientTable.PurposeOfGrant: WIU faculty awards and grants, education

Form990ScheduleIPartIV.Identifier: Procedure for Monitoring Grants in the U.S.:
Form990ScheduleIPartIV.Explanation: Schedule I, Part I, Line 2: Grants to individuals are in the form of scholarships. The Foundation applies those directly to student accounts to be applied to appropriate expenses. Grants made to Western Illinois University are monitored by Western Illinois University's internal audit department for compliance with state regulations. In addition, all expenditures require proper approval.

GeneralExplanation.Identifier: Form 990, Part VI, Section A, line 2
GeneralExplanation.Explanation: John McMillan (Board Director) is the husband of Cathy McMillan (Non-voting, Ex-Officio Director). Meredith Berg (Hancks)(Non-voting Ex-Officio Director) is the wife of Jeffrey Hancks (Non-voting Ex-Officio Director). Amy Spelman (Non-Voting Ex-Officio Director) is the wife of Bradley Bainter (Non-Voting Ex-Officio Director). John McMillan (Board Director-Professional) and Doug March (Board Director) are each lawyers and one third owners in the law firm of March, McMillan, and DeJoode, PC.

GeneralExplanation.Identifier: Form 990, Part VI, Section B, line 11
GeneralExplanation.Explanation: Foundation accountants provide documentation to the tax preparer to prepare the 990 form, including answers to "yes/no" questions. The tax preparer uses all information to prepare the 990. After the 990 is prepared, the accountants in the foundation review the return for any discrepancies. Once all discrepancies have been addressed with the tax preparer, the return is taken to the board (at minimum the executive committee) for review and comment. If no problems are noted, the return is ready for signing and processing.

GeneralExplanation.Identifier: Form 990, Part VI, Section B, line 12c
GeneralExplanation.Explanation: The board of directors discloses conflicts of interest annually.

GeneralExplanation.Identifier: Form 990, Part VI, Section B, line 15
GeneralExplanation.Explanation: Key employees of the Western Illinois University Foundation are paid by Western Illinois University (a related organization and governmental entity). Western Illinois University establishes all hiring procedures and pay policies for employees of the Western Illinois University Foundation. When key employees are recruited, an Administrative Compensation Survey conducted by the College and University Processional Association from Human Resources (CUPA-HR) is used to get a salary range. However, the actual offer is based on an individual's qualifications. A search committee comprised of employees from various areas with various backgrounds is used during key employee searches.

GeneralExplanation.Identifier: Form 990, Part VI, Section C, line 19
GeneralExplanation.Explanation: 990 Tax Forms from 2006 through the present are available at www.guidestar.com. Membership to Guide Star is free, and anyone wishes to see our tax forms are encouraged to visit this Website. Forms are also available by request to individuals who contact the Foundation office directly. The Foundation's audit report is also available on our Website through a link that will take you to our report, which is loaded on the Illinois Auditor General's Website.
